journeys.title: Healing and Restoration After Divorce
journeys.summary: Missions to stabilize your emotions, rebuild peace, and start healing without rushing your process.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming stronger and steadier.

missions.title: Text Your Safe Person
missions.subtitle: Tell one trusted person you need support this week.
missions.whyThisMatters: Healing is faster and safer when you don’t carry it alone.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Text one trusted person today and ask for support.

cards.title: Send this text
bullets: “Hi, I’m going through a lot. Can you check on me this week?”
“I need someone safe to talk to.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Support is strength, not shame.

completionCard.title: You chose support
completionCard.message: You didn’t isolate today. That matters.

missions.title: Clear One Small Space
missions.subtitle: Remove one painful reminder from one visible spot.
missions.whyThisMatters: Your environment affects your emotions. Small changes reduce daily pain.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one small area: bedside, shelf, phone wallpaper, car.
Remove one item that reopens the wound.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: You’re not erasing history. You’re protecting your peace.

completionCard.title: You protected your peace
completionCard.message: That small change reduced emotional weight.

missions.title: Do a 3-Breath Reset
missions.subtitle: Calm your body when emotion rises.
missions.whyThisMatters: Your body carries stress. Calming your body helps your mind calm down too.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Breathe out slowly (4 seconds). Repeat 3 times.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Calm body first. Calm choices follow.

completionCard.title: You calmed yourself
completionCard.message: You led your emotions instead of being led.

missions.title: Create a No-Contact Window
missions.subtitle: Reduce contact for 24 hours if it is safe to do so.
missions.whyThisMatters: Constant contact keeps wounds open. Space creates clarity.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: If it is safe, avoid unnecessary contact for 24 hours.
If co-parenting, keep messages short and about the child only.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Space is not hatred. Space is healing.

completionCard.title: You created space
completionCard.message: That space helped your heart breathe.

missions.title: Write One Truth
missions.subtitle: Write one sentence that keeps you grounded.
missions.whyThisMatters: When emotions swing, one truth helps you stand.

completionCard.title: You stayed grounded
completionCard.message: One truth can stop a spiral.

missions.title: Block One Digital Trigger
missions.subtitle: Remove one online trigger that pulls you back into pain.
missions.whyThisMatters: Digital triggers can restart healing pain in seconds.

cards.title: Pick one
options: Unfollow one account that triggers you
Delete one chat thread you keep reopening
Remove old photos from your lock screen

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: You’re protecting your heart, not being petty.

completionCard.title: You reduced triggers
completionCard.message: That choice made healing easier today.

missions.title: Move Your Body for 10 Minutes
missions.subtitle: Take a walk or do light exercise.
missions.whyThisMatters: Movement helps your brain release stress and sadness.

completionCard.title: You helped your body
completionCard.message: Your body processed stress better today.

missions.title: Talk to God Honestly
missions.subtitle: Pray like you really feel.
missions.whyThisMatters: Honest prayer reduces shame and brings comfort.

completionCard.title: You invited comfort
completionCard.message: Prayer brought you back to peace.

missions.title: Take One Future Step
missions.subtitle: Do one small future-focused action.
missions.whyThisMatters: Future steps help you stop living only in the past.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Healing Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit to repeat daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small daily habits build steady healing.

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You started healing with steady steps.

journeys.title: Processing Past Relationship Pain
journeys.summary: Missions to process what hurt you, stop emotional bleeding, and regain your peace without denial.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming stronger and steadier.

missions.title: Name the Pain Clearly
missions.subtitle: Say what hurt you in one clear sentence.
missions.whyThisMatters: Vague pain lingers. Named pain can be handled.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Write one sentence: “What hurt me most was ______.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Clear words reduce confusion.

completionCard.title: You named it
completionCard.message: Naming pain is a step toward freedom.

missions.title: Stop Self-Blame Today
missions.subtitle: Remove unfair blame from your mind.
missions.whyThisMatters: Some people blame themselves for everything. That delays healing.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Replace it with: “I did my best with what I knew.”

missions.title: Release One Item
missions.subtitle: Let go of one object you are holding onto.
missions.whyThisMatters: Some items keep you emotionally tied to pain.

cards.title: Pick one
options: Box one item and put it away
Remove one gift that reopens pain

completionCard.title: You loosened the grip
completionCard.message: Letting go creates room for peace.

missions.title: Write What You Learned
missions.subtitle: Extract one lesson without shame.
missions.whyThisMatters: Lessons turn pain into wisdom.

completionCard.title: You gained wisdom
completionCard.message: Wisdom is the reward of pain when you learn.

missions.title: Time-Box Your Sadness
missions.subtitle: Give yourself 10 minutes to feel it, then stop.
missions.whyThisMatters: If sadness has no boundary, it can take your whole day.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When time ends, stand up and move your body.

completionCard.title: You held your day
completionCard.message: You felt it without losing your whole day.

missions.title: Talk to a Safe Person
missions.subtitle: Share one hard truth with someone safe.
missions.whyThisMatters: Pain grows in silence. Healing grows in safe connection.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell a safe person one thing that still hurts.
Ask them to pray with you if you want.

missions.title: Stop Replaying the Movie
missions.subtitle: Interrupt rumination once today.
missions.whyThisMatters: Replaying scenes keeps you stuck.

missions.title: Calm Your Body
missions.subtitle: Use a quick reset when emotions rise.
missions.whyThisMatters: Calm body helps calm mind.

missions.title: Pray for Healing
missions.subtitle: Ask God to heal what you cannot fix alone.
missions.whyThisMatters: God heals deep places with time and grace.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Processing Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit to repeat daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Consistency makes healing real.

cards.title: Choose your habit
options: I stop replaying and do one task
I talk to a safe person twice this week

journeys.title: Rebuilding Identity and Self-Worth
journeys.summary: Missions to rebuild your confidence, reject shame, and see yourself as valuable again.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming stronger and steadier.

missions.title: Remove One Shame Sentence
missions.subtitle: Replace one shame thought with truth.
missions.whyThisMatters: Shame steals your confidence. Truth restores it.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Today, replace one shame sentence in your mind.

missions.title: Show Up Well Today
missions.subtitle: Do one thing that makes you feel put-together.
missions.whyThisMatters: Small confidence actions rebuild identity.

completionCard.title: You showed up
completionCard.message: You treated yourself like you matter.

missions.title: Receive a Compliment
missions.subtitle: Say thank you without rejecting it.
missions.whyThisMatters: Low self-worth rejects love. Practice receiving.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: When someone compliments you today, don’t argue.

missions.title: Stop Proving Yourself
missions.subtitle: Do not over-explain yourself today.
missions.whyThisMatters: People-pleasing is often self-worth struggle.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Say no once today without long reasons.
Repeat your no calmly if needed.

missions.title: Write Your Strength List
missions.subtitle: List 5 strengths you still have.
missions.whyThisMatters: Divorce can damage your self-image. Strength lists restore reality.

completionCard.title: You remembered who you are
completionCard.message: You saw strengths that never left.

missions.title: Set a Worth Boundary
missions.subtitle: Stop giving access to people who disrespect you.
missions.whyThisMatters: Self-worth shows up as boundaries.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Reduce access today: mute, distance, short replies.

missions.title: Do One Small Goal
missions.subtitle: Take one step on a personal goal.
missions.whyThisMatters: Goals rebuild identity beyond relationship status.

completionCard.title: You rebuilt identity
completionCard.message: You moved forward as a whole person.

missions.title: Serve Someone
missions.subtitle: Do one small act of kindness.
missions.whyThisMatters: Serving reminds you that you still have value to give.

completionCard.title: You gave value
completionCard.message: You remembered you can bless others.

missions.title: Pray About Your Identity
missions.subtitle: Ask God to restore your identity.
missions.whyThisMatters: Identity rooted in God cannot be destroyed by a season.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Worth Habit
missions.subtitle: Repeat one self-worth habit daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Repetition makes confidence real.

cards.title: Choose your habit
options: I replace shame with truth daily
I do 10 minutes of a goal daily

journeys.title: Letting Go of Resentment and Lingering Conflict
journeys.summary: Missions to release bitterness, stop mental fights, and regain peace—without pretending what happened was okay.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming stronger and steadier.

missions.title: Name Your Resentment
missions.subtitle: Write what you are still angry about in one sentence.
missions.whyThisMatters: If you can’t name it, you can’t release it.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Write one sentence: “I still feel angry about ______.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: This is not approval. This is honesty.

completionCard.title: You named it
completionCard.message: Naming resentment is the first step to letting it go.

missions.title: Stop the Argument in Your Head
missions.subtitle: Interrupt one mental fight today.
missions.whyThisMatters: Mental fights drain you and keep you tied to the past.

completionCard.title: You broke the loop
completionCard.message: You regained control of your mind.

missions.title: Write the Cost
missions.subtitle: List 3 ways resentment is affecting you.
missions.whyThisMatters: When you see the cost, release becomes easier.

completionCard.title: You saw the cost
completionCard.message: Seeing the cost makes change easier.

missions.title: Close One Open Loop
missions.subtitle: Stop one thing that keeps conflict alive.
missions.whyThisMatters: Some habits keep conflict going even after divorce.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Peace grows when you stop feeding conflict.

completionCard.title: You closed a loop
completionCard.message: That choice reduced conflict inside you.

missions.title: Send a Boundary Message
missions.subtitle: Set one clear boundary if contact is hurting you.
missions.whyThisMatters: Boundaries protect your peace and reduce repeated fights.

cards.title: Send this
bullets: “I will only respond to important issues.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: If co-parenting, keep it child-focused.

missions.title: Say Your Release Sentence
missions.subtitle: Say one sentence to release control.
missions.whyThisMatters: Release starts with a decision, then becomes a habit.

cards.title: Say this
bullets: “God, I release this anger from my heart.”

completionCard.title: You chose release
completionCard.message: That decision moved you toward peace.

missions.title: Do One Peace Action
missions.subtitle: Do one thing that calms you today.
missions.whyThisMatters: Peace is built with small actions, not just thoughts.

completionCard.title: You built peace
completionCard.message: Your body and mind got relief.

missions.title: Define Forgiveness Clearly
missions.subtitle: Write what forgiveness is and is not for you.
missions.whyThisMatters: Forgiveness does not mean returning to harm.

cards.title: Write two lines
bullets: Forgiveness is not: trusting them again without proof.

missions.title: Pray for Peace
missions.subtitle: Ask God to give you peace that stays.
missions.whyThisMatters: Peace is a gift and a practice.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Release Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit to repeat daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Daily habits reduce lingering conflict.

cards.title: Choose your habit
options: I do one peace action daily

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You practiced releasing resentment and choosing peace.

journeys.title: Rebuilding Trust Safely
journeys.summary: Missions to rebuild trust wisely—without rushing, ignoring red flags, or trusting words without proof.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming stronger and steadier.

missions.title: Set Your Trust Rules
missions.subtitle: Write 3 rules for trust in your next relationship.
missions.whyThisMatters: Trust is built with rules, not vibes.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Write 3 trust rules you will follow.

cards.title: Examples
bullets: I don’t trust words without consistent actions.

completionCard.title: You set rules
completionCard.message: Rules protect your heart while you heal.

missions.title: Watch Actions for One Week
missions.subtitle: Focus on patterns, not promises.
missions.whyThisMatters: Patterns reveal truth faster than words.

missions.title: Take One Small Trust Step
missions.subtitle: Practice trust in a safe, small way.
missions.whyThisMatters: Trust grows with small steps, not big leaps.

cards.title: Pick one small step
options: Keep one promise to yourself today
Share one small truth with a safe person

missions.title: Do a Red Flag Check
missions.subtitle: Name the top 3 red flags you will not ignore.
missions.whyThisMatters: Ignoring red flags is how people repeat pain.

missions.title: Verify One Claim
missions.subtitle: Verify one story with simple evidence.
missions.whyThisMatters: Safe trust includes verification, not paranoia.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick one claim that matters (work, kids, location).
Verify it gently with facts over time.

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: You can be kind and still be wise.

missions.title: Slow the Pace
missions.subtitle: Reduce intensity for one day.
missions.whyThisMatters: Rushing can hide problems.

missions.title: Have a Trust Conversation
missions.subtitle: Ask one direct question about trust.
missions.whyThisMatters: Direct questions prevent future confusion.

cards.title: Ask this
bullets: “What does honesty look like to you?”

missions.title: Use a Boundary in Real Life
missions.subtitle: Say no once today without guilt.
missions.whyThisMatters: Boundaries build self-trust.

completionCard.title: You built self-trust
completionCard.message: Self-trust helps you trust others wisely.

missions.title: Pray for Discernment
missions.subtitle: Ask God for wisdom in relationships.
missions.whyThisMatters: Discernment helps you trust safely.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Trust Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit to repeat daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Habits prevent repeating old mistakes.

cards.title: Choose your habit
options: I slow the pace when I feel rushed

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You practiced trusting wisely and safely.

journeys.title: Emotional Readiness for Remarriage
journeys.summary: Missions to confirm you are ready, heal your weak spots, and enter love again with stability and wisdom.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming stronger and steadier.

missions.title: Do Your Readiness Check
missions.subtitle: Answer 5 yes/no questions honestly.
missions.whyThisMatters: Remarriage is safer when you are emotionally ready.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Answer these 5 questions with yes/no.

cards.title: Questions
bullets: Can I talk about my divorce without rage?
Can I see my faults without shame?
Am I stable financially enough for now?
Do I trust God with my future?

missions.title: Close One Loose End
missions.subtitle: Handle one unfinished divorce-related task.
missions.whyThisMatters: Loose ends keep emotional stress alive.

missions.title: Make Your Trigger Plan
missions.subtitle: Plan what you will do when you feel triggered in dating.
missions.whyThisMatters: Triggers will happen. A plan keeps you steady.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Name your top trigger (tone, silence, money, jealousy).
Choose your response (pause, pray, talk calmly).
Save the plan in your notes.

missions.title: Write Your Boundary List
missions.subtitle: Write 5 boundaries you will keep in dating.
missions.whyThisMatters: Boundaries protect your peace and your future marriage.

missions.title: Get Counsel
missions.subtitle: Talk to a mentor about remarriage readiness.
missions.whyThisMatters: Wise counsel reveals blind spots.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Share your biggest fear about remarriage.

missions.title: Get Financial Clarity
missions.subtitle: Write your basic monthly costs.
missions.whyThisMatters: Money stress harms relationships. Clarity protects you.

missions.title: Choose a Healthy Model
missions.subtitle: Pick one healthy marriage model to learn from.
missions.whyThisMatters: Good models replace bad patterns.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Pick a healthy couple or mentor.

missions.title: Practice Your Honest Story
missions.subtitle: Share a short, honest version of your story.
missions.whyThisMatters: Your story should be honest but not bitter.

cards.title: Say this
bullets: “I was married before. It ended, and I learned a lot.”
“I’m healing and I’m serious about doing better.”

completionCard.title: You practiced maturity
completionCard.message: Your story sounded steady and healthy.

missions.title: Pray for a Ready Heart
missions.subtitle: Ask God to prepare your heart for love.
missions.whyThisMatters: God can heal and prepare you for a new season.

cards.title: Pray this
bullets: “God, prepare my heart for healthy love.”

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Readiness Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit to repeat daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Consistency strengthens readiness.

cards.title: Choose your habit
options: I use my trigger plan when upset
I keep my boundary list daily
I pray for a ready heart daily

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You practiced emotional readiness for remarriage.

milestones.title: Halfway through
milestones.message: You are becoming stronger and steadier.

missions.title: Write Your Non-Negotiables
missions.subtitle: Write 5 non-negotiables for your next relationship.
missions.whyThisMatters: Non-negotiables stop you from choosing love based on loneliness.

cards.title: Your mission
cards.text: Write 5 non-negotiables you will not compromise.

completionCard.title: You set standards
completionCard.message: Standards protect you from repeating pain.

missions.title: Watch Character in Stress
missions.subtitle: Notice how they act under pressure.
missions.whyThisMatters: Real character shows in stress, not in romance.

cards.title: What to watch

missions.title: Have a Values Conversation
missions.subtitle: Ask 3 questions that reveal values.
missions.whyThisMatters: Clear questions prevent hidden surprises.

cards.title: Ask these

missions.title: Do a Consistency Check
missions.subtitle: Look for patterns, not one good day.
missions.whyThisMatters: Consistency is more important than charm.

missions.title: Update Your Red Flag List
missions.subtitle: Write 5 red flags you will not ignore.
missions.whyThisMatters: Red flags ignored become future tears.

completionCard.title: You protected yourself
completionCard.message: Clear red flags protect your peace.

missions.title: Slow the Pace
missions.subtitle: Reduce intensity for one day to think clearly.
missions.whyThisMatters: Slowing down helps you see clearly.

missions.title: Check Your Body Signal
missions.subtitle: Notice what your body feels around them.
missions.whyThisMatters: Your body often notices danger before your mind admits it.

missions.title: Get Counsel Before You Commit

missions.whyThisMatters: Wise counsel reveals blind spots.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Tell a mentor what you are seeing.

missions.title: Pray for Discernment
missions.subtitle: Ask God to help you see clearly.
missions.whyThisMatters: Discernment is spiritual and practical.

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Discernment Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit to repeat daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Habits help you avoid repeating your past.

cards.title: Choose your habit

completionCard.title: Journey complete

cards.text: Write one sentence: “Covenant means ______ to me.”

cards.title: Tip
cards.text: Covenant is serious, but it can still be joyful.

missions.title: Clarify Your Values
missions.subtitle: Write 5 values you will build your marriage on.
missions.whyThisMatters: Values guide decisions when feelings change.

missions.title: Prepare Your Heart
missions.subtitle: Release one fear about marriage today.
missions.whyThisMatters: Fear can sabotage new love if ignored.

cards.title: Say this
bullets: “God, I release this fear from my heart.”

completionCard.title: You released fear
completionCard.message: That step made your heart lighter.

missions.title: Create Your Accountability Plan
missions.subtitle: Choose who will keep you accountable in marriage.
missions.whyThisMatters: Accountability protects covenant.

cards.title: Steps
bullets: Decide how often you will check in.

missions.title: Create Your Conflict Plan
missions.subtitle: Write how you will handle conflict in your new marriage.
missions.whyThisMatters: Conflict is normal. A plan prevents damage.

completionCard.title: You created a plan
completionCard.message: A plan protects love in hard moments.

missions.title: Prepare Your Money Agreement
missions.subtitle: Write 3 money rules you will follow as a couple.
missions.whyThisMatters: Money issues break marriages when unclear.

missions.title: Set Your Purity Boundary
missions.subtitle: Set one boundary that protects your covenant mindset.
missions.whyThisMatters: Purity boundaries protect your heart and your future home.

missions.title: Have the Covenant Talk
missions.subtitle: Ask your partner how they view covenant and commitment.
missions.whyThisMatters: Alignment on covenant is non-negotiable.

cards.title: Ask these
bullets: “What does faith leadership look like to you?”

missions.title: Pray for Your Home
missions.subtitle: Pray for your future marriage and home.
missions.whyThisMatters: Prayer anchors covenant in God.

cards.title: Pray this
bullets: “God, build my future home on You.”
“Help me love with wisdom and faithfulness.”

missions.title: Choose Your 7-Day Covenant Habit
missions.subtitle: Pick one habit to repeat daily.
missions.whyThisMatters: Habits protect covenant long-term.

cards.title: Choose your habit
options: I keep my values in mind daily
I practice my conflict plan daily
I pray for my home daily

completionCard.title: Journey complete
completionCard.message: You prepared for a new covenant with wisdom and clarity.
